website_summaries.verdict: Designed by experts, this is a great model for those who want visits from both butterflies and hummingbirds.
pros: This feeder was specially designed and tested by biologists to be effective
It can serve butterflies that like nectar and fruit, and the red top attracts hummingbirds
There are also helpful instructions for making nectar in the package
cons: This model attracts bees and ants, and the red top fades quickly, which can be unattractive
It can be tedious to disassemble and reassemble for cleaning

customer_reviews.title: Works well at the end of the season
customer_reviews.text: There was a review that suggested scuffing the surface with an emery board and that worked really well. I work with butterflies and we needed some supplementation of nectar for the end of our season and the butterflies started feeding very quickly. I used the Songbird nectar mix and it was easy to make. Flowers are the ideal source of nectar for butterflies, but if there is nothing else available they will feed from this feeder. You can certainly make your own nectar mix with sugar and water, but keep in mind that insects need salt so it would be a good idea to add a little salt to your mix as well.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Good for bees. Butterflies? Not so much
customer_reviews.text: 1 star for butterfly attraction, 5 stars for bees. Let me start by saying I already have a yard full of butterflies, bees, and hummers. I thought this would be a nice “free lunch” for butterflies. They couldn’t care less about it. The hummers took a little interest in the beginning, but honey bees took over in the end. Giving it 3 stars because feeding honey bees is a good thing! If you want butterflies in your yard, plant native host plants! (Milkweed, Passion flower etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Hppytravels

customer_reviews.title: Hasn't worked for my Mom in SoCal
customer_reviews.text: My 92 year old Mom has a room in board & care where she can see out a large slider. So I noticed a lot of butterflies and got this for "entertainment"...also put pot of Lantana and impatients nearby. It is positioned in partial shade of a pomegranate tree and a bird bath. The butterflies fly right by...the bees are attracted so took out the wicks as suggested...still attacts the bees and ants...a couple Hummers, but NOT ONE butterfly...dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: LE

customer_reviews.title: it attacts all kinds of pretty things
customer_reviews.text: it was wonderful to see the butterflies, but soon there were humming birds, and other critters sucking on the threads. I made a huge batch of nectar since it doesnt hold a lot and went thru it quickly. My cats were amazed watching out the window at all the fluttery things.
customer_reviews.author: Dejibo

customer_reviews.title: Butterfly feeder
customer_reviews.text: Came quick even without my amazon prime. I love my butterfly feeder..I didnt even know they exist! I also have a butterfly house which i didnt know existed either so i was excited to get this. i havnt seen any butterflies yet I have only had it for less than a week.....but it looks so pretty in my garden and i will up date once i see them feeding... its very easy to put together, simply directions and even has the butterfly nectar recipe. which is just 2 teaspoons of sugar to some water. i love it
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: A Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: We put this out and refilled it several times with fresh nectar. Although we have plenty of butterflies, we never saw one go near it. Also, the red plastic fades in the sunlight. You're better off planting flowers that attract butterflies.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S.

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat skeptical when I first saw this product on Amazon and even more skeptical once I took it out of the box. But, the results can't be disputed. I have beautiful butterflies feeding at it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth R.

customer_reviews.title: My garden bees and butterflies enjoy it!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and clean, bought the powdered nectar for this and my friends really drink from it!
customer_reviews.author: CocoMollyFluffy

customer_reviews.title: Bee magnet
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a hummingbird feeder when I read other reviews stating it attracted bees. After being in place only two days I can confirm it is a bee magnet. I may purchase others in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: earl bishop

customer_reviews.title: Attracted wasps and when a monarch investigated, it couldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Attracted wasps and when a monarch investigated, it couldn't get near. Maybe change color or only use when rearing butterflies indoors?
customer_reviews.author: Sean's mom

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long
customer_reviews.text: This product only lasted me about a month before I had to throw it out. The bees really enjoyed it while it lasted and I saw a hummingbird every now and then, but I never saw any butterflies go near it.
customer_reviews.author: Cristi

customer_reviews.title: Never seen a butterfly feed from it. Have seen ...
customer_reviews.text: Never seen a butterfly feed from it. Have seen a hummingbird go to it but it doesn't hold much liquid to keep the hummers interested.
customer_reviews.author: Lightnings Angel

customer_reviews.title: Read directions.
customer_reviews.text: I used it for feeding butterflies and hope hummingbirds will find it too.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGEANN GAMBLE

customer_reviews.title: Pretty and easy to use butterfly feeder
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use butterfly feeder. It's easy to assemble, easy to clean and it looks nice in the garden. It's still early in the season but I'm starting to see butterflies in the garden so I'm hoping they will come to the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz

customer_reviews.title: Haven't seen butterflies near it
customer_reviews.text: Cute. Bees like it but I don't think butterflies do
customer_reviews.author: Laura b hollenbeck

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all. Had it up for over a week with nothing landing on it. Followed directions exactly. Have butterflies all over my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Fun and it works
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Clear instructions. Put it up last week. First butterfly seen on it today!!
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: got it for butterfly and i'm attracting humming birds to it
customer_reviews.author: antoinette

customer_reviews.title: Songbird essential butterfly feeder
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it 5 stars however it needs a disclaimer or a way to stop ants from being attracted to it. Butterflies will not show with them about. The wasps however do.
customer_reviews.author: Steffon

customer_reviews.title: Not a success.
customer_reviews.text: I tried the nectar mix and used both banana and watermelon slices to entice the Monarchs to feed. No dice. They showed absolutely no interest in the feeder, even though they were all around the plants near it. For me, a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jack16

customer_reviews.title: Butterfly Nectar & Fruit Feeder
customer_reviews.text: I got this thinking it would be great. I have seen butterflies in the yard but they don't use the feeder. I am disappointed. I have talked to friends about it and they have never heard of butterfly feeders. I was hoping to attract them to the yard. Save your money. At least this is my experience.
customer_reviews.author: michigan

customer_reviews.title: No Luck, Faded in the Sun and eventually fell off the branch.
customer_reviews.text: Attracting Butterflys, Fail. I'm sure they would work better in an enclosure, like the Butterly exhibit we went to in SF, but not out in our yard.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky2bGorgeous

customer_reviews.title: In place
customer_reviews.text: It has attracted Hummingbird also which is fine. Color of the Red screw cap faded within 6 days in the Florida sun. Other than that it work great.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Pittillo

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple addition to our garden
customer_reviews.text: I think this will be a fun addition to our garden. So far, only hummingbirds have visited, but hopeful the butterflies will come, too. Bought one for me and one for my 3 year old grandson who is learning about the life cycle of butterflies.
customer_reviews.author: Joy B.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not one butterfly so far and I've had it out for at least a month.
customer_reviews.author: Shitzumamma

customer_reviews.title: Seems to get some "winged takers" for the nectar
customer_reviews.text: Works ok. I'm not sure what is good or bad re numbers of butterflies seen feeding. It doesn't seem to be heavily frequented by our Monarch passers-by (coming in for the MilkWeed), but a one here and there is seen landing on this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: DanaDiego

customer_reviews.title: Super small
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed at how small this item was for the price. If I had paid more attention to the size, I would not have spent the money on this. It's not even worth using it's so small.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Excited to see butterflies use this
customer_reviews.text: So excited to see my butterflies use this. I've always fed the hummingbirds but seeing more butterflies in the garden this year so I decided to try this.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Lauffer

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I see butterflies in my yard, but have yet to see one at the feeder after 2 months. I tried butterfly food and fresh fruit, but no luck. Like others have said, the red top faded quickly. That wouldn't bother me if there was activity at the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: CarolM

customer_reviews.title: The Butterflies love it
customer_reviews.text: Easy and loading it with Butterfly feed is a easy. Then if you place a ripened banana on it. It makes it even more lovely for them. I would recommend this for anyone who enjoys seeing them come.
customer_reviews.author: David Edwards and Tina Edwards

customer_reviews.title: The threaded post into the tray is not snug and ...
customer_reviews.text: The threaded post into the tray is not snug and loose. When hanging the tray can drop to ground.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Farrington

customer_reviews.title: NO BUTTERFLIES YET
customer_reviews.text: Followed the instructions to the T. Alas----No butterflies. I'd think twice before buying. Maybe they will show up later in the year.
customer_reviews.author: G. Colin Mulcahy

customer_reviews.title: ... nature and helps her Dad in their garden - perfect learning gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my great-niece for her 6th birthday to supplement the Butterfly Nectar - She is always interested in nature and helps her Dad in their garden - perfect learning gift.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Mckenna

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The butterflies have not touched it but the hummingbirds are loving it.
customer_reviews.author: Narcissa Black

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: My family was very happy to see the butterflies in the backyard
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Guy 45896

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for a butterfly habitat and then for ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a butterfly habitat and then for outdoors after we released our butterflies.. No butterflies ate from this feeder in either environment.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Manasco

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Recipe is easy and it works well. Nice addition to the garden
customer_reviews.author: H. Kenkel

customer_reviews.title: No butterflies
customer_reviews.text: After a month I hadn't seen one butterfly. I figured a butterfly feeder would attract butterflies as easily as a humming bird feeder attracts hummers, but not so.
customer_reviews.author: Robin L

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: The only thing it attracted was flies (not the butter kind). I have butterflies in my yard, but they totally ignored this.
customer_reviews.author: D. Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: So cute in the picture with the 3 butterflies on it-but alas, butterflies in my yard flying all around it, not one ever landed!! Disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again or recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Fills with water every time it rains. May be ok if in sheltered area. Did attract a hummingbird. Would not buy again or recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: packed incorrectly with heavy stuff on top of it , came broken
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Silvernail

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Never saw one butterfly on this, just lots of yellow jackets
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The feeder was ALOT smaller than I expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Way to go for butterflies
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed as there was no nectar, you have to make it yourself. I don't know why it says Butterfly. Nectar and Fruit Feeder. It should say something like HOLDER for butterfly Nectar and Fruit. Other units I have seen were more expensive and nectar was included, but when I saw this price I could not turn it down. Now I realized I should have because it is ONLY the feeder and NOT the nectar.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Marquardt

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful addition
customer_reviews.text: It was just as it was advertised. It looks great hanging on my deck. Cannot wait to see the butterflies feeding.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Vasquenz

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to have a single butterfly (so thats on my part)
customer_reviews.author: Tasha

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little feeder
customer_reviews.text: This will make a nice addition to my husband's birdfeeding stations. Butterflies and birds - two wonderful creatures to watch.
customer_reviews.author: Of Books and Boys

customer_reviews.title: Bees Bees And More Bees
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in an effort to bring the butterflies into my Sons memorial garden. within days no butterflies however attracted Bees, so many that they would not let me get near the feeder. In the late afternoon I had attracted so many bees I had to take it down after dark so that I would not get stung. I would not recommend this product to those wanting to attract butterflies as the bees will find it first and claim it. The bees even chased away any humming bird that tried to get some of the nectar. Nightmare product.
customer_reviews.author: Mechelle

customer_reviews.title: No butterflies yet, but plenty of ants
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice design and well thought out and should serve the purpose. I've had it out for a week now and successfully drowned a ton of ants, but haven't seen any butterflies on it yet. I've got high hopes though.
customer_reviews.author: R. Michael Oguin

product_meta.title: Songbird Essentials SE78200 Butterfly Feeder (Set of 1)
feature_bullets: Songbird Essentials Butterfly feeders holds 6 oz of nectar + fruit pieces
Birght yellow and red to attract butterflies
Easy to assemble, fill, and clean
